page.title: 18LOCAL NEWS Lifeguard Patrol
page.content: {Lifeguard Patrol on Portobello Beach.{ Throughout the summer members of the newly formed{Edinburgh Lifeguard Club will patrol a section of Portobello Beach every Sunday from noon to 4pm. They will provide a rescue and first aid service for beach users as well as offering advice to bathers about water conditions. Each patrol will end with a{rescue demonstration. This service has only been made possible by months of hard training to obtain the necessary qualifications and through fund raising events to purchase the special safety equipment. Distinctive red and yellow flags mark the area which the Lifeguards can cover at present but the next major equipment target is a{rescue boat}_ costing around Â£1500 _ so that ultimately the whole beach, from Joppa to Seafield, can be patrolled.
